Sen. panel approves Kerry

By a voice vote today, the Senate Foreign Relations Committee approved Sen. John Kerry's nomination for secretary of state. A full Senate vote is expected later today. (Globe, 11:16 a.m.)
  • Interactive Who's who in reshuffled Cabinet?
  • Pictures Who might succeed Kerry?

Aly Raisman tweets criticism of MIAA

The Olympic gold medalist and Needham native expressed her disappointment in the Massachusetts Interscholastic Athletic Association's decision to drop boys gymnastics. (Globe, 10:11 a.m.)
  • Discuss Should the MIAA keep boys gymnastics?

Winter? Wicked warm weather on way

Tomorrow will feel like spring with temperatures nearing 60 degrees, but the warm-up won't last too long, the National Weather Service said. (Globe, 10:45 a.m.)
  • Watch WBZ Accuweather forecast  |  Full details

“Southie Rules” from A&E TV, which premieres tonight at 10 p.m., revolves around the Niedzwiecki family, who all live under the same Southie triple-decker roof.

Ex-aide: Author Cornwell masked gifts

Patricia Cornwell's former finance manager told jurors he fudged financial records to "mask" political donations, a violation of campaign finance laws. (Globe)

Chinese firm purchase of A123 approved

Wanxiang America Corp. said it has won approval from a federal panel to acquire nearly all assets of Waltham battery maker A123 Systems. (Globe, 11:01 a.m.)
